column4: Hi, how do I restart a process immediately after it get aborted, like restarting it after reboot. I want some of my process to be allways up and running. I am talking about the gearman workers (prcesses) if anybody know gearman. Please help, I have been searching for it for a long time and I have lost hope.
are you using upstart to manage it?
I don't know upstart. Is it some program?
upstart is ubunut's init daemon
how do you start this gearman software?
but it will be only for the reboot condition. what for the fail/abort
you have to install gearmand first and start the gearmand daemon like gearmand -d
upstart provides facilities to respawn processes (see "respawn" in the upstart cookbook)
Started reading respawn and upstart hold on.
anyway, the other options I know about are daemontools and just using a "while true; do COMMAND; done" loop.  upstart is probably the "nicest" way I know about
started readin the man page for upstart and it looks goood
http://upstart.ubuntu.com/cookbook/
Slart, I think the upstart or init is for the reboots and respawn is to restart after every abort. Also I don't have /etc/inittab what do I need for this?
Slart, respawn looks promising
respawn is something you can add to an init job configuration.  I don't know why you are looking for /etc/inittab
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9072879/how-to-use-linux-software-watchdog this link was given to me by Slart . I was referring to it from the discussion on this links
ubuntu uses upstart, read the upstart docs
you can ask the #upstart guys if upstart will respect the "respawn" lines in /etc/inittab but I doubt it
thus why I said you would need to create an upstart job and include "respawn" in it.  See the upstart cookbook for examples of this
you need to enable user jobs in upstart
